label: 高野日記
本: The Weaving of Mantra:  Kūkai and the Construction of Esoteric Buddhist Discourse . Columbia University Press . 1999
説明文: A collection of poems (composed by the eminent medieval poet-priest Ton'a (1301-1384)) during his pilgrimage to the sacred mountain, [in which he] relates the story  of how Kūkai came to invent the native Japanese kana syllabary (p. 113). [頓阿、仮名]
